tossups.question: Idaho’s Hagerman Fossil beds name an early species in this family. Anchitherium, a member of this family, crossed the Bering land bridge to Asia. A member of this family bred by Lord Morton was seen as evidence for the theory of telegony ("tel-EH-gun-ee"). Members of this family suffer from an upper-respiratory tract infection known as strangles. The kiang and quagga are members of this family. Thomas Henry Huxley used Othniel Marsh’s fossils to describe a straight evolutionary line from forest dwelling species like (*) eohippus to modern members of this family. Nikolai Przewalski names a small endangered member of this family. Alongside rhinoceroses and tapirs, this family is part of the odd-toed ungulates. For 10 points, zebras and donkeys are part of which family of animals?

Nikolai Przewalski names a small endangered member of this family. Alongside rhinoceroses and tapirs, this family is part of the odd-toed ungulates. For 10 points, zebras and donkeys are part of which family of animals?
tossups.answer_sanitized: Equidae [accept horses or donkeys or asses]

Heather Morris wrote a novel about a (*) Tattooist of this place. If This is a Man is a memoir by Primo Levi about Survival in this place. Eliezer is taken from Sighet to this place in the novel Night. For 10 points, name this concentration camp where Elie Wiesel was taken before being liberated from Buchenwald.
tossups.answer_sanitized: Auschwitz-Birkenau [accept Auschwitz II-Birkenau or Auschwitz III-Monowitz; prompt on concentration camps]

tossups.question: Bruce Fordyce has won an annual long-distance running event held in this country a record 9 times. A man from this country won Olympic silver in long jump at Rio 2016, and became the World Champion in 2017. A thirteen-time Paralympic champion from this country competed at the able bodied 10k swim at the Beijing Olympics. Michael Johnson’s 400m world record was (*) broken by an athlete from this country. In 2016, a woman from this country became the first to defend the women’s Olympic 800m title but has since been forced to take medication to lower her natural testosterone levels. For 10 points, Luvo Manyonga, Wayde van Niekerk ("Wade Van KNEE-kerk"), and Caster Semenya represent which country?

In 2016, a woman from this country became the first to defend the women’s Olympic 800m title but has since been forced to take medication to lower her natural testosterone levels. For 10 points, Luvo Manyonga, Wayde van Niekerk ("Wade Van KNEE-kerk"), and Caster Semenya represent which country?
tossups.answer_sanitized: South Africa

tossups.question: King Kayabaya reunited the Kediri dynasty on this island and made a series of prophecies in his role as a Just King, or ratu adil. The Sangiran site on this island was inhabited for 1.5 million years. The Nagarakretagama is one of a number of traditional kakawin poems from this island which eulogize the legendary ruler Hayam Wuruk who expanded the Majapahit Empire to neighbouring islands. The Sailendra dynasty built the world’s largest (*) Buddhist temple on this island. This island is home to Borobudur Temple, and a Pithecanthropus erectus skeleton found on this Indonesian island is called the missing link between humans and apes. For 10 points, what is the most populous island in the world?
tossups.question_sanitized: King Kayabaya reunited the Kediri dynasty on this island and made a series of prophecies in his role as a Just King, or ratu adil.  The Sangiran site on this island was inhabited for 1.5 million years. The Nagarakretagama is one of a  number of traditional kakawin poems from this island which eulogize the legendary ruler Hayam Wuruk who expanded the Majapahit Empire to neighbouring islands. The Sailendra dynasty built the world’s largest (*) Buddhist temple on this island. This island is home to Borobudur Temple, and a Pithecanthropus erectus skeleton found on this Indonesian island is called the missing link between humans and apes. For 10 points, what is the most populous island in the world?
tossups.answer_sanitized: Java

parts: One can determine which half of the pH scale a buffer is on by dipping in a paper strip containing this combination of lichen compounds and observing if it turns red or blue.

This compound is ubiquitous in biochemistry, where it forms part of the TAE and TBE buffers. This compound’s common name is an IUPAC prefix for a certain number of identical modifications.

parts: Name these devices used to solve big equations, which are stronger than those available to normal consumers.

UMass Dartmouth’s Gravity Grid and the US Air Force’s Condor Cluster were made by joining together these products, which could run Folding@Home (“folding at home”).

bonuses.leadin: In this play, the chorus declares that this is its author’s best work, and mocks other authors who rely on characters wearing fake penises for comedic effect. For 10 points each:
bonuses.leadin_sanitized: In this play, the chorus declares that this is its author’s best work, and mocks other authors who rely on characters wearing fake penises for comedic effect. For 10 points each:
parts: Identify this play that makes fun of Socrates. In this play, the aging Strepsiades decides that the only way he can get out of his debts is to attend the Thinkery and learn the art of sophistry.

The chorus extols the virtue of The Clouds and laments its poor reception in this section of the play. In this section of a Greek comedy, the actors leave the stage and the chorus speaks directly to the audience.
The Clouds is a play by this author of many Greek comedies, including The Birds, The Wasps, and The Frogs.

bonuses.leadin: The Shockley-Queisser curve limits the theoretical efficiency of these objects and has an unusual roughness from how the atmosphere affects the sun’s spectrum. For 10 points each:
bonuses.leadin_sanitized: The Shockley-Queisser curve limits the theoretical efficiency of these objects and has an unusual roughness from how the atmosphere affects the sun’s spectrum. For 10 points each:
answers: solar cells [or photovoltaic cells; accept solar panels or photovoltaic modules]
thin-film solar cells [or thin layers; accept thin-film deposition; anti-prompt on monolayers]
answers_sanitized: solar cells [or photovoltaic cells; accept solar panels or photovoltaic modules]
thin-film solar cells [or thin layers; accept thin-film deposition; anti-prompt on monolayers]
parts: Name these objects, which generate a current in the presence of light. Early development of these objects was motivated by their use to power satellites.
Some of the simplest solar cells avoid heavy metals in favor of this kind of silicon. Solids of this kind lack the long-range order of a crystal and include glasses.

Amorphous silicon, copper indium gallium diselenide, and cadmium telluride are found in this form in a class of cheap but less efficient solar cells. Katherine Blodgett developed a method for depositing oils onto a surface in this form while at General Electric.
